statement.p: Law, Theory, Experiment, Hypothesis, or Observation

p.em: Classify each statement as a law, a theory, an experiment, a hypothesis, or an observation.

li.p:
Ice always floats on liquid water.
choose an answer
law
theory
experiment
hypothesis
observation

A student in CH 151 proposes that the more sleep students get at night, the better they will perform on the first exam.
choose an answer
law
theory
experiment
hypothesis
observation

Numerous experiments by a large body of scientists have reinforced the concept that organisms can change their characteristics over time using the process of natural selection.
choose an answer
law
theory
experiment
hypothesis
observation

When ice was added to water, the temperature of the water decreased after the ice melted.
choose an answer
law
theory
experiment
hypothesis
observation

The ingredients of Ivory soap were analyzed to see whether it really is 99.44% pure, as advertised.
choose an answer
law
theory
experiment
hypothesis
observation
A hypothesis is a tentative explanation that can be tested by further investigation.
A theory is a well-supported explanation of observations.
A scientific law is a statement that summarizes the relationship between variables.
An experiment is a controlled method of testing a hypothesis.
An observation implies a description of the quality of an object or the specfic details of a change seen.

li.p: This is a general statement of a relationship between the properties of liquid and solid water, so it is a law.
This is a possible explanation for better exam scores, so it is a hypothesis.
This is a statement that explains how sepcies change their characteriestics over time using the support of many experiments by numerous people, so it is a theory.
The temperature is observed before and after a change is made in a system, so these are observations.
This is an analysis designed to test a hypothesis (in this case, the manufacturer’s claim of purity), so it is an experiment.
